sentences.en: All of them had run afoul of the law at some time or other.
sentences.cn: 他们所有人都曾触犯过法律。

sentences.en: Be careful not to fall afoul of the law.
Brazil's politicians and legislators often afoul of the law, as well.
sentences.cn: 巴西的政客以及议员也常常违法.

sentences.en: He retired from the navy, ran afoul of an epidemic of trained nurses in Boston.
sentences.cn: 他从海军退役回家后, 也染上了当时的流行病,只顾去纠缠波士顿的护士了.

sentences.en: He will run afoul of the law if he steals.
sentences.cn: 如果他偷窃,他会触犯法律的.

sentences.en: His recent troubles make him the latest high - profile tycoon to run afoul of authorities.
sentences.cn: 这些麻烦使得他成为近期与当局发生冲突最多的商界巨头.

sentences.en: Professor Umbridge ran afoul of our centaur Dumbledore.
sentences.cn: 乌姆里奇教授跟我们的那些马人发生了冲突.

sentences.en: Speedsters can expect to fall afoul of the law sometimes.
sentences.cn: 开快车早晚会触犯法规.

sentences.en: The boat afoul of a buoy.
The boat ran afoul of a buoy.
The kites were afoul in the wind.
The ship ran afoul of the floating seaweed.
sentences.cn: 船只和漂浮的海草纠缠在一起.

sentences.en: The thief ran afoul of the policemen.
This ran afoul of the law.
Why do you always fall afoul of me?

phrases.tran_cn: 碰撞，同某物撞在一起；和某人发生冲突

trans.tran_cn: （与法律、规章等）相抵触、有冲突，（船）与…相撞
trans.tran_en: to do something that is not allowed or legal, or that is against people’s beliefs
